page.title: 10WRAGBY PARISH CHURCH
page.content:
The Parish Church in Wragby goes back to the early Sixteenth Century, with records of births, baptisms and marriages from 1538, amongst the earliest in England.
The Church is famous for its Sixteenth Century stained glass windows which were collected by Mr. Winn who is now buried in the Church grounds. At present these have been removed for safety reasons as the NCB are mining coal from under the Church.
The present Church organ was installed in the Church in 1902 replacing an older worn out organ. It originally came from the Priory music room in which it was placed in 1844 but parts of it are thought to be older. The Church has hundreds of visitors of various nationalities each year.
